com.feathersui.maven.plugin.lime_openfl

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.feathersui.maven.plugin.lime_openfl.Window

  • public class Window
extends Object
    Represents the <window> element of the Lime project.xml format.

    The following example sets the fps and allowHighDpi fields. 

     
 <limeProject>
   <window>
     <fps>60</fps>
     <allowHighDpi>true</allowHighDpi>
   </window>
 </limeProject>
    See Also:
    Lime project.xml format: <window>

    • Field Detail

      • width

        public Integer width
        The default width of the main window. Represents the <window width=""> attribute of the Lime project.xml format.

        The following example sets the <width> element. 

         
 <limeProject>
   <window>
     <width>640</width>
   </window>
 </limeProject>

      • height

        public Integer height
        The default height of the main window. Represents the <window height=""> attribute of the Lime project.xml format.

        The following example sets the <height> element. 

         
 <limeProject>
   <window>
     <height>480</height>
   </window>
 </limeProject>

      • background

        public String background
        The background color of the main window. Represents the <window background=""> attribute of the Lime project.xml format.

        The following example sets the <background> element. 

         
 <limeProject>
   <window>
     <background>#CCCCCC</background>
   </window>
 </limeProject>

      • fps

        public Integer fps
        The frames per second. Represents the <window fps=""> attribute of the Lime project.xml format.

        The following example sets the <fps> element. 

         
 <limeProject>
   <window>
     <fps>60</fps>
   </window>
 </limeProject>

      • fullscreen

        public Boolean fullscreen
        Whether the main window defaults to full screen or windowed. Represents the <window fullscreen=""> attribute of the Lime project.xml format.

        The following example sets the <fullscreen> element. 

         
 <limeProject>
   <window>
     <fullscreen>true</fullscreen>
   </window>
 </limeProject>
